title: Oil giant Shell launches another $3.5 billion share buyback as profit beats expectations
summary: Shares of Shell have climbed more than 16% so far this year, outperforming its industry peers.

title: Indian Oil Corp. Seeks to Replace Russian Oil With American Barrels
summary: Indian Oil Corp. is looking to buy 24 million barrels of crude oil from the Americas in the first quarter of next year to replace lost Russian supply after the latest U.S. sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil. title: ‘Golden Bachelor’ Star Mel Owens Admits to High Expectations Ahead of His Season. Were They Met?
summary: The 60-and-over group of eliminated women convened to confront the reality star during Wednesday night's 'Women Tell All' reunion show, before the season heads into its final episodes.

title: U.S. Nuclear Output Forecast to Surge 27% After 2035
summary: U.S. nuclear generation is projected to rise by 27% between 2035 and 2060, according to new analysis from Wood Mackenzie, as the rapid build-out of artificial-intelligence and cloud-computing infrastructure reshapes national electricity demand. title: Reeves looks at early scrapping of windfall tax on UK oil and gas sector
summary: Chancellor seeks assurances from industry that the move would boost investment in North Sea

title: U.S. Issues License for Rosneft’s German Assets Amid Expanding Sanctions Web
summary: The United States has issued a general license allowing limited operations of Rosneft’s German subsidiaries, according to a notice posted on the company’s website and confirmed by Reuters. title: China Targets Iron Ore in Its Fight to Dethrone the Dollar
summary: In a landmark move that could reshape global commodity markets and impact iron ore prices, BHP Billiton has agreed to settle 30% of its iron ore spot trades with Chinese buyers in Chinese Yuan (RMB). This represents a significant departure from the longstanding U.S. dollar standard. Set to begin in…
